intro: Tetranthera albicans, commonly known as the white tetranthera, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale green flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tetranthera albicans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
